name: Augustus Loop
description: A versatile stereo audio delay and looping effect inspired by the Augustus Loop tape delay/looper. Offers independent control over loop length, pitch shift, filtering, and tape emulation parameters.
use_cases: Delay effects with external processing in the feedback loop
gui_description: The display shows the feedback amount bottom left and the delay time bottom right. The centre area shows an animation indicating the tape direction and speed. If using a clock input, the word 'Clock' flashes up every time the algorithm receives a clock pulse. The word 'Tap' is displayed if the tap tempo function will set the delay time on the next tap i.e. it shows whether tap tempo is 'live'.

params.name: Time (coarse)
params.description: Sets the delay time. The coarse and fine delay times are added to produce the actual delay time.

params.name: Time (fine)
params.description: Sets an adjustment to the delay time, in milliseconds. The coarse and fine delay times are added to produce the actual delay time.

params.name: Delay multiplier
params.description: A multiplier to apply to the delay time set by the parameters, the tap tempo, or the clock. See manual for values.

params.name: Feedback
params.description: The overall delay feedback amount.

params.name: L-L Time
params.description: Scales the delay time of the left-to-left feedback path, as a percentage of the overall delay time.

params.name: L-R Time
params.description: Scales the delay time of the left-to-right feedback path, as a percentage of the overall delay time.

params.name: R-L Time
params.description: Scales the delay time of the right-to-left feedback path, as a percentage of the overall delay time.

params.name: R-R Time
params.description: Scales the delay time of the right-to-right feedback path, as a percentage of the overall delay time.

params.name: L-L Level
params.description: Scales the amount of the delayed left signal mixed into the left feedback path.

params.name: L-R Level
params.description: Scales the amount of the delayed left signal mixed into the right feedback path.

params.name: R-L Level
params.description: Scales the amount of the delayed right signal mixed into the left feedback path.

params.name: R-R Level
params.description: Scales the amount of the delayed right signal mixed into the right feedback path.

params.name: Mono-ize
params.description: Reduces the stereo width of the incoming signal. At zero the signal is reduced to mono, at a pan position set by the 'Initial pan' parameter.

params.name: Initial pan
params.description: Sets the pan position of the mono-ized signal. -100 is fully left; 100 is fully right.

params.name: Dry gain
params.description: The amount of the dry signal to mix into the outputs. At "-40" there is no dry signal at all i.e. it's actually –∞dB.

params.name: Effect gain
params.description: The amount of the effect (delay) signal to mix into the outputs. At "-40" there is no effect signal at all i.e. it's actually –∞dB.

params.name: Input level
params.description: Attenuates the input signal fed to the tape write head.

params.name: Pitch inertia
params.description: Sets the amount of 'inertia' or slew on the pitch CV input. At zero, the tape speed follows the pitch input closely; at the maximum value, pitch changes are quite gradual.

params.name: Stop tape
params.description: When on, the tape speed is set to zero. Note that the Pitch inertia affects how quickly the tape stops and starts.

params.name: Reverse tape
params.description: When on, the tape is reversed. Note that the Pitch inertia affects how quickly the tape reverses.

params.name: Bit depth
params.description: Controls the bit depth used in the delay memory (note, not the bit depth used in any other processing). Setting this to '0' (16 bit) doubles the maximum delay time.

params.name: Inertia free
params.description: Enables 'Inertia free' mode. See manual for details.

params.name: Inertia fade time
params.description: The fade time to use when in Inertia free mode.

params.name: Pitch CV input
params.description: The CV input to use for pitch. 0 = None.

params.name: Pitch LFO speed
params.description: Sets the speed of the pitch modulation LFO.

params.name: Pitch LFO depth
params.description: Sets the depth of pitch modulation by the LFO.

params.name: Clear loop
params.description: When on, instigates a rapid clear of the delay buffer (while maintaining passthrough of the dry signal).

params.name: Filter type
params.description: Sets the filter type. Smoothly fades between thru, low pass, band pass, high pass, and back to thru.

params.name: Filter freq
params.description: Sets the filter frequency.

params.name: Filter Q
params.description: Sets the filter resonance.

params.name: Saturation enable
params.description: Enables the saturation processing (on the tape output, before the filter).

params.name: Saturation
params.description: Sets the depth of the saturation effect, by applying gain before the saturation waveshaper.

params.name: Saturation shape
params.description: Controls the shape of the saturation. At '100' the effect is that of soft saturation and clipping. At '0' the effect is of hard digital clipping. Note that at shape settings other than '0', some alteration is applied to the signal even if the Saturation level is zero.

params.name: Clock input
params.description: The CV input to use as the clock. The delay time is set as the time between two rising clock edges. 0 = None.

params.name: Tap tempo
params.description: When this parameter transitions from 0 to 1, the algorithm acts on a tap tempo event. See tap tempo, below.

params.name: Clocks required
params.description: Sets the number of consistent clocks required to change the delay time. See manual for details.

params.name: Left input
params.description: Sets the bus for the left input.

params.name: Right input
params.description: Sets the bus for the right input.

params.name: Left output
params.description: Sets the bus for the left output.

params.name: Right output
params.description: Sets the bus for the right output.

params.name: Output mode
params.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above.

params.name: FX Loop position
params.description: Enables the effects loop and sets in position the signal flow. See manual for details.

params.name: FX Loop output L
params.description: Sets the left output to the effect loop. 0 = None.

params.name: FX Loop output R
params.description: Sets the right output to the effect loop. 0 = None.

params.name: FX Loop input L
params.description: Sets the left input from the effects loop. 0 = None.

params.name: FX Loop input R
params.description: Sets the right input from the effects loop. 0 = None.
